channel.title: What the hell? Compiler won't work
channel.description:
Ok. I have run the compiler before, on my laptop. But my harddrive died. Now, I'm on my 2nd harddrive on my desktop, Drive F. So I have jdk 6.1, I have the perfect compiler.
I have added a path and classpath in the environmental values.
But Whenever I change the C drive values in the perfect compiler to F it doesn't work anymore. I have tried using the basic compiler with the F drive, but it doesn't work either. Let me show you my classpath and path and make sure they're right.
CLASSPATH : CLASSPATH=F:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_01\bin;%CLASSPATH%;. PATH : F:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_01\bin

item.title: What the hell? Compiler won't work
item.dc:creator: @PatScape PatScape
item.description:
@PatScape wrote:

That doesn’t work, i still get the error

javac: file not found: *.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: server Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic
item.source: What the hell? Compiler won't work

item.title: What the hell? Compiler won't work
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Classpath: "F:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_01\bin\"

Path: "F:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_01\bin\";"F:\Windows\System32\"

And, for the compiler + runserver itself:

@echo off
javac *.java
java -cp . server
pause

Above is the preferred way. But if you want to run the less knowledgable way, just use my Perfect Compiler 1.9.

Read full topic
item.source: What the hell? Compiler won't work
